partners.name: Ministry of Education, Science and Technology
partners.description: The Ministry of Education is responsible for overall development of education in the country.
partners.contact_person: Ministry of Education/Department of Education, Nepal

partners.name: Teach For All
partners.description: A network of 50 independent, locally led and governed partner organizations working to accelerate the network's progress.

partners.name: Surya Nepal Pvt. Ltd.
partners.description: A leading Nepalese company committed to community development, focusing on education, women's empowerment, agriculture, and social entrepreneurship.

partners.name: Golchha Group
partners.description: A pioneering industrial group in Nepal with a legacy of 100 years, contributing significantly to the economy.

partners.name: Sarvodaya USA
partners.description: A nonprofit organization dedicated to building a world of communities based on non-violence, service, and cooperation.

partners.name: Nepal Rising
partners.description: A US-based nonprofit organization empowering Nepali Americans to drive positive change in Nepal.

partners.name: Everest Bank Limited
partners.description: A leading bank in Nepal providing professionalized and efficient banking services.

partners.name: Siddhartha Bank Ltd.
partners.description: A leading Nepali bank renowned for its customer-centric approach and digital innovation.

partners.name: Daya Foundation
partners.description: A registered Nepalese non-profit organization dedicated to empowering local communities.

partners.name: Kings College, Nepal
partners.description: A premiere Business School in Nepal offering BBA and MBA degrees and providing scholarships to TFN Fellows.

partners.name: Merojob.com
partners.description: Nepal's leading job portal connecting job seekers and employers since 2009.

partners.name: Vianet Communications
partners.description: One of the leading providers of high-speed Internet connectivity and communications solutions in the Kathmandu Valley.

staff_members.name: Swastika Shrestha
staff_members.role: Chief Executive Officer, Co-founder and Director of Training and Support
staff_members.bio: Swastika Shrestha has dedicated her career to facilitating life and leadership development among youth in Nepal and the US. After completing her masters in the US, she worked with UNMIN and consulted for IUCN, WFP, and UNDP. Her passion for youth development led her to Teach For Nepal, where she nurtures leaders to transform classrooms, communities, and the nation.

staff_members.name: Krishna Kumar K.C.
staff_members.bio: Krishna Kumar K.C. has spent over 24 years teaching in primary and secondary schools in Lalitpur, including 10 years as a Head Teacher in Ashrang. He has witnessed the challenges faced by community schools and believes that with the right mindset, teachers can overcome these challenges. He is proud to be part of the movement to set new trends and raise the leadership skills of a new generation.

staff_members.name: Khika Prasad Nepal
staff_members.bio: Khika Prasad Nepal transitioned from a teaching career to the development field, working for over 12 years. He holds a Masters of Sociology from Tribhuvan University. At Teach For Nepal, he works closely with Fellows, Leadership Development Coordinators, and Managers, feeling accomplished when he sees Fellows making a real change in schools and communities.

staff_members.name: Ankush Upreti
staff_members.role: Head of Recruitment Selection and Matriculation (TFN Alumni)
staff_members.bio: Ankush Upreti's transformative experience as a TFN Fellow ignited his passion for youth leadership and educational equity. In his current role, he is dedicated to identifying and nurturing aspiring young leaders who are committed to tackling Nepal's educational crisis and becoming lifelong leaders.

staff_members.name: Madhav Prasad Devkota
staff_members.role: Head of Training & Community Support (TFN Alumni)
staff_members.bio: As a TFN Fellow, Madhav Prasad Devkota aimed to teach his students beyond academics, including personal hygiene, community sanitation, and balanced diet. In his current role, he serves as a role model and source of inspiration for Fellows, helping them face challenges and thrive in their Fellowship.

staff_members.name: Ruma Maharjan
staff_members.bio: Ruma Maharjan believes that equity in education is key to resolving inequities and biases in Nepal. With her background as a recruiter and Events Manager, she is committed to playing a part in the movement for equitable education, ensuring that every child has the opportunity to reach their potential.

staff_members.name: Rebati Ram (Rafael) Poudel
staff_members.bio: Rebati Ram Poudel has a deep-rooted commitment to Nepal's development landscape, having worked in various roles including School Relations and Placement Coordinator, Director at Youth Initiative, and consultant for the International Labour Organization (ILO). His journey has reinforced his passion for impactful work in education reform.

staff_members.name: Sadhana Shrestha
staff_members.bio: Sadhana Shrestha returned to Nepal after completing her Master's Degree in Germany, driven by a desire to make a purposeful impact. As a Selection Manager, she is dedicated to selecting candidates who are passionate about making a difference in classrooms and communities.

staff_members.name: Preeti Shrestha
staff_members.bio: Preeti Shrestha has been involved with Teach For Nepal since 2015, driven by her belief in education's ability to unleash human potential. In her current role, she embraces the ethos of finding the silver lining and uncovering the inherent goodness within, dedicated to the overarching vision of Teach For Nepal.

staff_members.name: Shripa Padhan
staff_members.bio: Shripa Padhan has worked with marginalized communities, leading advocacy and capacity-building initiatives. Her background in mental health and community-centered work grounds her approach in empathy and intersectionality. She joined Teach For Nepal to amplify the voices of Fellows and support their work in achieving equity, community, and systemic change.

staff_members.name: Shekhar Kumal
staff_members.bio: Shekhar Kumal has over 10 years of experience in financial management, budgeting, accounting, and compliance within international development programs. He is dedicated to ensuring smooth and efficient financial management at Teach For Nepal, embodying the values of transparency, accountability, and donor compliance.

staff_members.name: Sami Manandhar
staff_members.bio: Sami Manandhar's journey with Teach For Nepal began as a Fellow, motivated by a desire to understand and contribute to environmental education. Now, as a Project Manager, he is committed to empowering children to become aware of climate change and be part of the solution.

staff_members.name: Jenisha Shakya
staff_members.bio: Jenisha Shakya is a dedicated educator and youth development professional with extensive experience in recruitment, leadership, and program management. She rejoined Teach For Nepal to inspire and recruit future leaders who share the vision of transforming education in Nepal.

staff_members.name: Asmita Guragain
staff_members.bio: Asmita Guragain's experience with Teach For Nepal has fueled her determination to drive change and eradicate educational inequalities. As a Recruitment Coordinator, she advocates for the inclusion of dynamic young leaders in the public education system, reshaping the narrative of possibility for every child.

staff_members.name: Gaurab Ghimire
staff_members.bio: Gaurab Ghimire's passion for educational equity and leadership development led him to join Teach For Nepal as a Leadership Development Coordinator. He is committed to supporting Fellows, especially during times of transition and challenge, and values the opportunity to give back to the organization that has shaped his own leadership.

staff_members.name: Samikshya Kharel
staff_members.bio: Samikshya Kharel's journey with Teach For Nepal began as an English Fellow, where she nurtured students' academic potential and personal growth. As a Leadership Development Coordinator, she mentors and supports new Fellows, helping them build the skills and confidence needed to create meaningful impact in their classrooms and communities.

staff_members.name: Lokesh Khadaka
staff_members.bio: Lokesh Khadaka is a purpose-driven community builder and advocate for quality education and youth leadership. As the Executive Coordinator at Teach For Nepal, he works closely with the Chief Executive Officer to advance the organization's mission and vision. His journey with Teach For Nepal has deepened his belief in the power of education to unlock human potential and promote sustainable living and development.

staff_members.name: Hari Krishna Khatri
staff_members.bio: Hari Krishna Khatri's journey from teaching to working in fintech and as a School Coordinator led him to Teach For Nepal, where he found a platform for vision, impact, and transformative change. As a Recruitment Coordinator, he supports and inspires passionate young leaders to join the TFN movement and shape Nepal's future.

staff_members.name: Akriti Paudel
staff_members.bio: Akriti Paudel's passion for equitable education began with a two-year fellowship as a Teach For Nepal Mathematics Fellow in the Sindhupalchok-Himalayan region. This experience fueled her interest in continuing her journey as a Leadership Development Coordinator, dedicated to nurturing, supporting, and guiding high-potential Fellows to create sustainable change in their classrooms and communities.

staff_members.name: Amir Khokhali
staff_members.bio: Amir Khokhali's journey from being a student taught by TFN Fellows to working for the organization is a testament to the impact of education and technology. With a background in computer application and technical skills, he aims to contribute to ensuring all children in Nepal receive an excellent education, showing that even kids from villages can turn challenges into achievements.

staff_members.name: Sirjana Dhital
staff_members.bio: Sirjana Dhital moved from her village in Dhading to Kathmandu to be closer to her brothers. She has been working at Teach For Nepal since its inception, believing in the importance of providing all children with the opportunity to learn and have a bright future.
